intro: Cicer arietinum var. macrospermum, commonly known as the large-seeded chickpea, is a cultivated variant of the chickpea plant. It is characterized by its larger, more robust seeds compared to standard chickpea varieties. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. Its pods contain several seeds that are used as a food source in various cuisines. This variety is valued for its high protein content and adaptability to different climates.
